snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.constraints module

class snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.constraints.ExpressionsBlock(market_type)[source]

Bases: object

Creates blocks for objective and constraint functions and assigns them to the Pyomo model.

property market_type

The market formulation to create blocks for.

set_expressions(model)[source]

Generates the objective and constraint expressions for model.

snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.utilities module

snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.utilities.read_caiso_data(fpath, year, month, nodeid)[source]

” Reads the historical LMP, regulation up/down and regulation mileage up/down for the year ‘year’, the month ‘month’ and for the node ‘nodeid’. Returns NumPy ndarrays for those three prices.

Parameters:

  • fpath (str) – The path to the root of the PJM data directory

  • year (int or str) – Year of data to read

  • month (int or str) – Month of data to read

  • nodeid (str) – ID of the node to read

Returns:

daLMP, RegCCP, RegPCP: Hourly LMP and regulation capacity/performance clearing price values.

Return type:

NumPy ndarrays

snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.utilities.read_ercot_da_ccp(fname, month)[source]

Reads the day-ahead market historical capacity clearing prices file at fname and returns NumPy ndarrays corresponding to the hourly regdn and regup prices.

Parameters:

  • fname (str) –

  • month (int or str) – which month to read data for; (int) [1, 12] OR (str) [‘1’, ‘12’]

  • fname – string giving location of DAM CCPs file

  • month – which month to read data for; (int) [1, 12] OR (str) [‘1’, ‘12’]

Returns:

NumPy ndarrays with regdn and regup CCPs for month

Return type:

Numpy ndarrays

snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.utilities.read_ercot_da_spp(fname, month, settlement_point)[source]

Reads the day-ahead market historical settlement point prices file at fname and returns the NumPy ndarray corresponding to the hourly price at settlement_point.

Parameters:

  • fname (str) – string giving location of DAM SPPs file

  • month (int or str) – which month to read data for; (int) [1, 12] OR (str) [‘1’, ‘12’]

  • settlement_point (str) – string giving settlement point name (hub or load zone)

Return spp_da:

NumPy ndarray with SPPs for month and settlement point

Return type:

NumPy ndarray

Returns NumPy ndarrays for those three prices. :param fpath: A string containing the path to the relevant historical ancillary services data file. :param year: An int corresponding to the year of interest :param month: An int corresponding to the month of interest (1: Jan., 2: Feb., etc.) :return: daLMP, RegCCP, RegPCP: NumPy ndarrays containing hourly LMP as well as regulation capacity/performance clearing price values.

  • month (int or str) – month of data

arrays of data specified

snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.valuation_dms module

class snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.valuation_dms.ValuationDMS(home_path, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: DataManagementSystem

A class for managing data for the energy storage valuation optimization functions. Class methods for each type of file to be loaded are included, extending from the get_data() method of the superclass. Each of these methods uses get_data() to retrieve the relevant data and loads the file and adds it to the DMS if the data is not loaded. An optional class method for calling each of the individual data methods can be included to, e.g., form the necessary arguments and return the desired variables.

Parameters:

home_path – A string indicating the relative path to where data is saved.

snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.valuation_optimizer module

exception snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.valuation_optimizer.BadParameterException[source]

Bases: Exception

exception snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.valuation_optimizer.IncompatibleDataException[source]

Bases: Exception

class snl.es_gui.tools.valuation.valuation_optimizer.ValuationOptimizer(price_electricity=None, price_reg_up=None, price_reg_down=None, price_reg_serv_up=None, price_reg_serv_down=None, price_regulation=None, price_reg_service=None, cost_charge=None, cost_discharge=None, mileage_mult=None, mileage_mult_ru=None, mileage_mult_rd=None, perf_score=None, perf_score_ru=None, perf_score_rd=None, fraction_reg_up=None, fraction_reg_down=None, market_type='arbitrage', solver='glpk')[source]

Bases: Optimizer

A framework wrapper class for creating Pyomo ConcreteModels for energy storage valuation.

property cost_charge

The cost of charging the energy storage device [$/MWh].

property cost_discharge

The cost of discharging the energy storage device [$/MWh].

property expressions_block

ExpressionsBlock object for setting model objectives and constraints.

property fraction_reg_down

The fraction of regulation down reserve capacity actually employed.

property fraction_reg_up

The fraction of regulation up reserve capacity actually employed.

get_results()[source]

Returns the decision variables and derived quantities in a DataFrame, plus the net revenue.

property gross_revenue

The net revenue generated over the time period as solved for in the optimization.

instantiate_model()[source]

Instantiates the Pyomo ConcreteModel and populates it with supplied time series data.

property market_type

The name of the market formulation to be modeled, defaults to ‘arbitrage’.

property mileage_mult

Mileage multiplier or ratio according to the selected market.

property mileage_mult_rd

Mileage multiplier or ratio for the regulation down service according to the selected market.

property mileage_mult_ru

Mileage multiplier or ratio for the regulation up service according to the selected market.

property perf_score

Performance score of the regulation service provided.

property perf_score_rd

Performance score of the regulation down service provided.

property perf_score_ru

Performance score of the regulation up service provided.

populate_model()[source]

Populates the Pyomo ConcreteModel based on the specified market_type.

property price_electricity

The price for buying electricity via energy arbitrage [$/MWh].

property price_reg_down

The price for providing regulation down products [$/MWh].

property price_reg_serv_down

The price for providing regulation down service; based on mileage or performance [$/MWh].

property price_reg_serv_up

The price for providing regulation up service; based on mileage or performance [$/MWh].

property price_reg_service

The price for providing regulation services; based on mileage or performance [$/MWh].

property price_reg_up

The price for providing regulation up products [$/MWh].

property price_regulation

The price for providing capacity for regulation services in pay-for-performance markets [$/MWh].

property results

Pandas DataFrame containing results.

property solver

The name of the solver for Pyomo to use, defaults to ‘glpk’.
